dialogues.text: Yeah. Smalls, Babe Ruth is the greatest baseball player that ever lived. People say he was less than a God, but more than a man. Ya know... like Hercules or somethin'. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ball that you just aced to The Beast is worth... well, more than your whole life. Scotty falls to his knees. Grabs his stomach.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTTY
dialogues.text: I don't feel so good. They all step back, expecting the worst. Then, they fan h with their baseball caps. 77

dialogues.speaker: SCOTTY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (HEARTFELT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta get that ball back.

dialogues.speaker: BENNY
dialogues.text: When does your old man get home from work?

dialogues.speaker: SCOTTY
dialogues.text: He's gone on business for a week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, we need 98 cents. So, everybody spread out and find some soda bottles and cash 'em in. We need a new baseball.

dialogues.speaker: A BRAND NEW BASEBALL
dialogues.text: Benny's hand signs B A BE RUTH across the leather in ridiculous chicken scrawl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forgery in progress. Benny does the honors.

dialogues.speaker: DENUNEZ
dialogues.text: I dunno, Benny-man.

dialogues.speaker: YEAH-YEAH
dialogues.text: Yeah-yeah, it's pretty crappy.

dialogues.speaker: SQUINTS
dialogues.text: He ain't gonna buy that, Benny. It doesn't look anything like the Babe's signature.

dialogues.speaker: BENNY
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter what it looks like. His mom's never gonna know the difference. This'll just buy us some time, ya dorks. CcuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty's HAND ENTERS FRAME. Little anxious FINGERS wrappe around the phony "Babe Ruth" baseball. The second the bal is back on its pedestal: 78

dialogues.speaker: MOM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Scotty?

dialogues.speaker: DEN
dialogues.text: Scotty whips 'round like he's been slapped by a wet macke Mom's in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTTY
dialogues.text: Huh?!

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Honey, what are you doing in here?

dialogues.speaker: SCOTTY
dialogues.text: Ah... just looking at Bill's - I mean Dad's baseball. Scotty hurries away from the "autographed" ball.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: You know he doesn't like you touching his things.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTTY
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know. Sorry, Mom.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Has he ever told you about that ball?

dialogues.speaker: SCOTTY
dialogues.text: Uh - no, not really, I don't think so - no, he hasn't at all - I don't know _anything_ about it.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: It's signed by Babe Ruth... Sweet mother of - Mom knows! Scotty may collapse.

dialogues.speaker: MOM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...the greatest baseball player that ever lived.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTTY
dialogues.text: Um... really?

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: It sure is. Dad's father gave it to him. Maybe someday, he'll give it to you.  79

dialogues.speaker: SCOTTY
dialogues.text: (DAZED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... neat.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: It was salt in an open wound. Even my own mom, who was only a grown-up girl, knew who Babe Ruth was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gang's all here. Big plans. War conference.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTTY
dialogues.text: So, how do we get it back?

dialogues.speaker: SQUINTS
dialogues.text: I have no idea.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: I was dead meat. I knew it. They knew it. We had thought that those cards Benny had gotten meant that something great was going to happen. Now I figured that they'd just meant my life was over.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTTY
dialogues.text: Can't we just hop the fence and get it?

dialogues.speaker: HAM
dialogues.text: Remember Davy Stodenrous.

dialogues.speaker: TIMMY/REPEAT
dialogues.text: Poor Toad.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTTY
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah. I forgot. (A THOUGHT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey? Why don't we just go over there and knock on the door, and ask Mr. Mertle to get it for us? Everyone looks at Scotty - the kid just sprouted a dunce cap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you outta your mind?! Mr. Mertle is the meanest old man that ever lived! He's the one that sicked The Beast on The Toad! (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not an option, Smalls. Forget about it. 80

dialogues.speaker: SCOTTY
dialogues.text: Oh. Okay. I will. Silent moments... not a single blinking idea between them Then, suddenly:

dialogues.speaker: SQUINTS
dialogues.text: We need to assess the situation!

dialogues.speaker: GANG
dialogues.text: (better than nothing) Of course! Right! Good one, Squints! Access (sic) the situation! Okay!

dialogues.speaker: BERTRAM
dialogues.text: Um, Squints? How do we do that?

dialogues.speaker: SQUINTS
dialogues.text: First we survey the enemy's environment, then we make note of the surrounding terrain.

dialogues.speaker: HAM
dialogues.text: What?...

dialogues.speaker: SQUINTS
dialogues.text: (COPPING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard that on "Combat." Let's just look out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gang pokes their heads-only through the window. They look down into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: airforce The house is a godforsaken stucco'd corpse.

dialogues.speaker: THE YARD
dialogues.text: is the final resting place for: melted frisbees, withered kickballs, skeletons of heat-crumbled paper kites, an of exposure-splintered balsa wood gliders, and a fleet of model rockets - their drag-chutes turning to dust. And hundreds of little empty craters - that used to cradle baseballs.

dialogues.speaker: THE RUSTY TOW CHAIN
dialogues.text: snakes through the dirt - buried then exposed. It termina

dialogues.speaker: THE LEAN-TO
dialogues.text: from under which rises hazy twirls of dust. The dust is k from ever settling by some enormous ORGANIC EXHAUST.

dialogues.speaker: A GIANT PAW-THING
dialogues.text: emerges from under the lean-to, pushing the Babe Ruth autographed cowhide into full view - "I dare you..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys jerk their heads back inside.

dialogues.speaker: TIMMY
dialogues.text: He's darin' us!

dialogues.speaker: REPEAT
dialogues.text: He's darin' us!

dialogues.speaker: DENUNEZ
dialogues.text: He's waitin' for us, man. Just like he did with The Toad.

dialogues.speaker: GANG
dialogues.text: (REVERENT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poor Toad.

dialogues.speaker: HAM
dialogues.text: We're on his territory now.

dialogues.speaker: BERTRAM
dialogues.text: Think he's pissed?

dialogues.speaker: BENNY
dialogues.text: Is Doby Gillis a dork? Anybody got any bright ideas?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tree house debate. Much shouting. Much disagreement. Many hands miming mechanical contraptions.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: We had absolutely no idea what the hell we were gonna do. So things started primitively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gang hurries out from the Timmons' yard carrying a br stick. They wriggle it under the fiberglass fence. Squint peers through the peep hole motioning directions to Ham. Suddenly - SNAP! Ham pulls the stick back. 'Tis toothpick 82

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys fell the clothes line pole with a hack saw. 6 fe of inch thick pipe. They heft it up - go out to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and shove the pipe under the green fiberglass. HORRIBLE ERUPT from the Badlands. Dust mushrooms over the fence. T pipe draws under in FEROCIOUS JERKS. Gone. Moments. The pole sails back over the fence - bounces on the asphalt w ANGRY CLANGS. 'Tis pretzel'd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bertram arrives. Hands "it" over. How embarrassing:

dialogues.speaker: BERTRAM
dialogues.text: It ain't mine. I told you, it's my little sister's! A Cootie Toy. They

dialogues.speaker: ASSEMBLE THE INSECT
dialogues.text: putting a hunk of chewed 'zooka on each Cootie foot. Atta it to a plastic parachute - ah-ha! Genius. An airborne assault!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Squints indicates "go."

dialogues.speaker: COOTIE N' CHUTE
dialogues.text: out the tree house window. It floats silently toward the baseball. The Cootie lands right on the Babe Ruth. The gu sticks.

dialogues.speaker: THE GANG
dialogues.text: hauls it in.

dialogues.speaker: THE BALL
dialogues.text: slowly rises. Suddenly 83

dialogues.speaker: THE BEAST'S JAWS
dialogues.text: erupt from 'neath the lean-to and CHOMP the Cootie whole. The string snaps.

dialogues.speaker: THE GANG
dialogues.text: pulls up the frayed end.  Cardboard

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now a War Room. Map of the Badlands: crazed trajectories, distances to The Beast, etc. Coffee can PBX system. periscope. X's on a calendar counting down "Bill's Return The new retreival system:

dialogues.speaker: THREE EUREKA CANISTER VACS
dialogues.text: all connected. Ham's catcher's mask bolted to the end pip for ball securing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toy flashlights and BSOA lanterns hang from the structure semi-illuminating the Badlands.

dialogues.speaker: OUT THE WINDOW
dialogues.text: goes the vacuumtraption, 30 feet of wobbly pipe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Squints directs the operation, looking

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH THE CARDBOARD PERISCOPE
dialogues.text: WE SEE the vacupipe-mask... 12 inches from the baseball.

dialogues.speaker: SQUINTS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (coffee can muffled) A-okay. Roger, affirmative. Initiate retreival suction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They throw eureka switch one. WEOHH!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The baseball moves itty-bittily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They throw eureka switch two. WEEOOOHHH! 84

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BASEBALL moves a lot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They throw eureka switch three! RRRWWEEEOOOHHH!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The baseball leaps from the ground - sticks in the catche mask collection basket.

dialogues.speaker: SQUINTS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: We have suction! Pull it up! PULL IT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gang reels it in. Suddenly, the whole apparatus JOLTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A great beef-paw yanks the end pipe under the tree.

dialogues.speaker: STEEL TEETH
dialogues.text: pinch the metal tube shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The vacuums build pressure fast. WHINE crazily.

dialogues.speaker: THE GANG
dialogues.text: leaps from tree house.

dialogues.speaker: SQUINTS
dialogues.text: lingers in the trap doorway a second too long:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gang (minus Squints) is face down in the dirt - arms over heads. The vacuums explode. Foggy clouds of dust pour out of the treehouse. Squints appears. He's battleship grey. Takes his glasses off. Only his eyes show white.

dialogues.speaker: SQUINTS
dialogues.text: We've been going about this all wrong.  rope through degrees. I blame myself. We need total surprise. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: SQUINTS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Therefore, we tunnel. The Beast will never expect it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys all wield a shovel, and have flashlights taped t their baseball caps like coal miners.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flashlight beam at the fore, Scotty crawls with a safety "round his waist. He pokes the cardboard periscope up the dirt.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH THE PERISCOPE
dialogues.text: the Badlands from ULTRA LOW ground level. WE SCAN 360 Suddenly, the scan stops. The name BABE RUTH, FILLS the periscope's lens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty's hand feels for the Babe Ruth. He grabs it. It's slimey.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTTY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (SUBTERRANEAN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got it! I got it! The ball SQUIRTS out of his fingers.

dialogues.speaker: THE BALL ROLLS
dialogues.text: beneath the lean-to. It hits

dialogues.speaker: THE BEAST
dialogues.text: in the nose. With a SEISMIC ROAR The Beast leaps out. WE DON'T SEE MUCH. He's too big. We're too close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah-Yeah SHOUTS to Ham at the tunnel entrance.

dialogues.speaker: YEAH-YEAH
dialogues.text: It's huge - oh, my God! It's huge — pull him out! It's huge! PULL HIM out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BEAST'S JAWS dive toward Scotty's hand. They get with an inch of Scotty's hand, and his fingers vanish - THWOOO 86

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gang pulls Scotty out of the hole. Yeah-Yeah is unconscious on the grass. The guys turn a hose on him. He comes 'round SCREAMING:

dialogues.speaker: YEAH-YEAH
dialogues.text: It's huge - pull him out! Oh God, it's like a dinosaur! Wh - Wh - Where am I?!

dialogues.speaker: SQUINTS
dialogues.text: Yeah-Yeah! Get hold of yourself! What'd you see?!

dialogues.speaker: YEAH-YEAH
dialogues.text: (accelerating to lunacy) Oh-oh, it was like hugeness and darkness and like the world was ending and the devil came up through the ground and the - and the - and the -

dialogues.speaker: HAM
dialogues.text: - somebody slap him quick! We're losin' him! WHAP-WHAP! Squints administers. Yeah-Yeah snaps out of it

dialogues.speaker: YEAH-YEAH
dialogues.text: Thanks. I needed that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Construction completes. A kid crane. A tricycle, block ' tackle, fishing-pole n' body harness. In a line, the guys step on and off a scale. Everybody stares at Yeah-Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: YEAH-YEAH
dialogues.text: Yeah-yeah, I know - I'm lightest. But I ain't goin' over there! NO WAY! All eyes to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: BENNY
dialogues.text: Sorry, Smalls. It was a good idea anyway.

dialogues.speaker: DENUNEZ
dialogues.text: Yeah, tough luck, Smalls.

dialogues.speaker: HAM
dialogues.text: It won't be that bad, Smalls. Your dad'1l probably only shoot you or something. 87

dialogues.speaker: YEAH-YEAH
dialogues.text: Hey-hey, don't blame me! I didn't hit the ball over there, man! Silence. Yeah-Yeah considers.

dialogues.speaker: YEAH-YEAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yeah-yeah, okay. But if I say pull me up, you guys better PULL ME UP! Benny takes Yeah-Yeah aside. Hands him all over Ham's catcher's gear.

dialogues.speaker: BENNY
dialogues.text: Here. Put these on.

dialogues.speaker: YEAH-YEAH
dialogues.text: Wha -? Why? Whadda I need All this stuff for Benny? I mean, why a mask and a gonad Protector?

dialogues.speaker: BENNY
dialogues.text: Oh, ah, nuthin', ya know, just For, ah... Altitude leveling  And stuff. Put it on. Benny hurries off as Timmy and Repeat approach with a frightening looking harnass assembly. Yeah-Yeah backs awa

dialogues.speaker: TIMMY
dialogues.text: Don't worry. We're professionals.

dialogues.speaker: REPEAT
dialogues.text: Our Dad's a contractor.

dialogues.speaker: HAM'S
dialogues.text: strapped in at the tricycle winch.

dialogues.speaker: YEAH-YEAH'S
dialogues.text: dangling over the lean-to.

dialogues.speaker: YEAH-YEAH
dialogues.text: (into can phone) Okay-okay, I'm right over it. Let me down - slow!

dialogues.speaker: HAM
dialogues.text: lets go. Oops. WHIZZZZ! 88

dialogues.speaker: YEAH-YEAH
dialogues.text: plummets.

dialogues.speaker: YEAH-YEAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ahhhh! Stop! STOP!

dialogues.speaker: HAM
dialogues.text: back-cranks.

dialogues.speaker: YEAH-YEAH
dialogues.text: comes to a twirling halt four feet off the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: into the lean-to. Blackness and dust.

dialogues.speaker: YEAH-YEAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: '"Kay-'kay, tip me, hurry up. I'm gettin’ the woollies. Yeah-Yeah reaches... Gets it!

dialogues.speaker: YEAH-YEAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay get me outta here!

dialogues.speaker: HAM
dialogues.text: struggles.

dialogues.speaker: YEAH-YEAH
dialogues.text: looks down from the guys on the tree house - back to leve "4 foot" eye-level with: THE BEAST'S MOUTH!

dialogues.speaker: YEAH-YEAH
dialogues.text: (QUAKING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: H - h - help! Help! HELP-HELP- HELP! (TRYING ANYTHING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hail Mary Father who art star light twinkle twinkle hey diddle diddle -

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE TREE HOUSE
dialogues.text: hands crank the trike wheel. Yeah-Yeah's to window level seconds. He's got the ball! 89

dialogues.speaker: THE BEAST'S JAWS
dialogues.text: leap into view.

dialogues.speaker: THE TOW CHAIN
dialogues.text: goes taut. The jaws abruptly disappear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Beast's shadowy form RUSTLES contentedly under the l to. Yeah-Yeah dropped the ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah-Yeah's shattered. Balling. The guys sniff. Oh no, ba news. He shoves them away:

dialogues.speaker: YEAH-YEAH
dialogues.text: Yeah-yeah, I did it! SO WHAT?! You jerks, I told you to pull me back faster! (starin' them down) You - you penises. Yeah-Yeah waddles away. The guys rush to hold the fence d up for him. He goes through stiff-legged (can't bend over

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah-Yeah heads across the field... waddle-waddle.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: Yeah-Yeah grew two feet in our eyes after that. There was no stinkin' way any of us would've showed back up, if we'd loaded our drawers. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah-Yeah did. He showed back up and got right to work, like nothing ever happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (LOCK OFF. Same as Sc. 157) - Yeah-Yeah returns across th sandlot and goes up into the treehouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 158 According to the calendar - 1 day till Bill's back. Scott got the conch. 90

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I know how to get it. (they're all ears) Anybody got an Erector Set? Eyes dart. Brows feint.

dialogues.speaker: SQUINTS
dialogues.text: That thing with the nuts and bolts and tiny wrenches that you can build junk out of?

dialogues.speaker: SCOTTY
dialogues.text: Exactly.

dialogues.speaker: SQUINTS
dialogues.text: Never heard of it.

dialogues.speaker: HAM
dialogues.text: I used to have one when I was like I dunno, a little kid.

dialogues.speaker: GANG
dialogues.text: (LIARS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Might have some pieces. Gee, I don't think so. I'd have to look. Maybe in the attic. Not in our room though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys re-arrive. Each holding huge arm loads of Erecto Set stuff.

dialogues.speaker: GANG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Guess I had more than I thought. Forgot my grandma got me some for my birthday. It's my little brother's. Scotty's brought his "Set." A footlocker full of neatly arranged pieces. Nut and bolt compartments. Electric moto sections.

dialogues.speaker: BERTRAM
dialogues.text: Bitchin'.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTTY
dialogues.text: I really like Erector Set.

dialogues.speaker: GANG
dialogues.text: (ATTITUDINAL 360'S)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too. I was just thinkin' the same thing. Couldn't agree more, Smalls.  I play with mine all the time. 91

dialogues.speaker: SCOTTY
dialogues.text: Let's get to work. Here's the plans - FURLSNAP! Holy cow! Scotty unfolds them - amazing crayola blueprints drawn on taped-together grocery bags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys swarm the tree house. Scotty supervises from the backyard, wearing a plastic hardhat. They build. Scotty hooks up electric motors. Throws one toggle, and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...it comes to life. A 35 foot hollow erector-beam and electric catapult-car assembly. They tilt-n'-tip it over fence. Scotty pilots the little car from the treehouse de

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benny's got his glove - waiting.

dialogues.speaker: BADLANDS
dialogues.text: Scotty on controls. Squints on periscope, with Bertram on the Yuban-comm for him. Others at support points. THE CAR drives down. THE BEAST strirs. THE CAR rolls out the end. THE CATAPULT BUCKET scoops the ball.

dialogues.speaker: SQUINTS
dialogues.text: (CLEANLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire!

dialogues.speaker: GIANT SLEEPY EYEBALLS
dialogues.text: roll open. A THUNDERROAR!

dialogues.speaker: SCOTTY
dialogues.text: flips the toggle.

dialogues.speaker: THE "RAT-TRAP" CATAPULT
dialogues.text: fires. 92

dialogues.speaker: THE BASEBALL
dialogues.text: is airborne.

dialogues.speaker: BENNY
dialogues.text: runs for it.

dialogues.speaker: BENNY
dialogues.text: I got it! I got it!

dialogues.speaker: THE AIRBORNE BEAST
dialogues.text: blocks out the sun. CLUNCHEENK! The Beast's FRONT TEETH SNATCH the Babe Ruth ball delicately out of the air.

dialogues.speaker: THE UNSEEN BEAST
dialogues.text: crash lands beyond the fiberglass paneling, right on top

dialogues.speaker: ERECTOR CONTRAPTION
dialogues.text: wrenching it viciously.

dialogues.speaker: THE STRUCTURE
dialogues.text: comes tumbling down - bending into flimsy knots as it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty stands alone on the tree house roof... staring dow into the Badlands. A little, wrecked shell of a kid, who now dead meat. The guys look up at him sorrowfully.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: the

dialogues.speaker: LIGHT
dialogues.text: Hasn't My life was over. Just as Bill had finally warmed up to me, and asked me to be the man of the house, I had to knock a priceless chunk of history into the clutches of a monster. Great. END THE BIG MONTAGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gang, minus Timmy and Repeat, shuffle along home with a word exchanged.

dialogues.speaker: FROM HIS PORCH
dialogues.text: Benny watches a dejected Scotty slowly head inside across street. 93

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty stares up at the ceiling in oceans of worry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is dark. Benny's in bed. He clicks on a "basebal bat" flashlight. Shines the beam toward his footboard... illuminating the photo of The Babe.

dialogues.speaker: BENNY
dialogues.text: We can't get it back, Babe. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. Suddenly, a RACKET from inside Benny's closet. A bright GOES ON in there. Then, smoke comes out. Benny jumps up on his bed - flattens against the wall. done this in years:

dialogues.speaker: BENNY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: M- M - Mom?... The closet door CREAKS open... by itself. Everything insi is oddly devoid of color.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's there?! BABE RUTH steps out of the closet. He exists in the only any kid from 1962 has ever seen him: BLACK & WHITE.

dialogues.speaker: THE BABE
dialogues.text: Now don't go peeing your pants or nuthin', I'm just here to give ya a hand. The Great Bambino PUFFS on a massive stogie... the source all the smoke.

dialogues.speaker: BENNY
dialogues.text: B - B - But, you're...

dialogues.speaker: THE BABE
dialogues.text: ...dead? Legends never die, kid. Benny comes off the wall. The enormous Ruth towers over h

dialogues.speaker: BENNY
dialogues.text: You're really him. You're The Babe. The Sultan of Swat. The King - 94

dialogues.speaker: THE BABE
dialogues.text: - of Krash and a hundred other dopey names. Forget about that, we ain't got much time. I'm here 'cause you're in some kinda pickle, right?

dialogues.speaker: BENNY
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: THE BABE
dialogues.text: A baseball with my John Hancock on it went over a fence, and you can't get it back. Right?

dialogues.speaker: BENNY
dialogues.text: Yeah, right.

dialogues.speaker: THE BABE
dialogues.text: (clear and simple) Then just hop over there and get it. There ya go. Problem solved. (tips his cap) See ya, kid. The Babe turns to go back to wherever he grabs his arm - shocked that he actually "real."

dialogues.speaker: BENNY
dialogues.text: Wait! I can't.

dialogues.speaker: THE BABE
dialogues.text: Can't what?

dialogues.speaker: BENNY
dialogues.text: Go into that backyard.

dialogues.speaker: THE BABE
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: BENNY
dialogues.text: There's a Beast back there.

dialogues.speaker: THE BABE
dialogues.text: What kind?

dialogues.speaker: BENNY
dialogues.text: A giant gorilla-dog-thing that ate one kid already.

dialogues.speaker: THE BABE
dialogues.text: Is that a fact? Listen to me, kid. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: THE BABE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Everybody gets one chance to do something great. Most people either never take the chance 'cause they're too scared, or they don't recognize it when it spits on their shoes. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is your "big chance," and ya shouldn't let it go by. came from. Benny feels something

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember those cards you got the other day?

dialogues.speaker: BENNY
dialogues.text: Sure, yeah, five Maury Wills all in the same pack.

dialogues.speaker: THE BABE
dialogues.text: What're the odds on that?

dialogues.speaker: BENNY
dialogues.text: About a zillion to one.

dialogues.speaker: THE BABE
dialogues.text: More even. Someone's tellin' you somethin', kid. And if I was you... I'd listen.

dialogues.speaker: BENNY
dialogues.text: Yeah, but what?

dialogues.speaker: THE BABE
dialogues.text: You're the one with the rubba legs. Figure it out. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta do what your heart tells you, else you'll spend the rest of your life wishin' you had.

dialogues.speaker: BENNY
dialogues.text: You mean, I should hop that fence - and pickle with THE BEAST?!

dialogues.speaker: THE BABE
dialogues.text: Lemme tell you something... you remember that called shot homer I hit?

dialogues.speaker: BENNY
dialogues.text: Sure, the greatest most famous and legendary home run of all time.

dialogues.speaker: THE BABE
dialogues.text: Yeah, right, well said. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you think I knew I was gonna swat that?

dialogues.speaker: BENNY
dialogues.text: Sure ya did, Babe.

dialogues.speaker: THE BABE
dialogues.text: Not a chance. Matter of fact, all the way down to first I kept sayin' to myself, "you lucky bum." (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think about that, kid. I'll see ya later. The Babe disappears back into the closet, then:

dialogues.speaker: THE BABE'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Remember, kid. There's heroes and there's Legends. Heroes get remembered... but Legends never die. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Follow your heart, kid, and you'll never go wrong. A RACKET in the closet matching:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KNUCKLES on glass. Scotty hurries sleepy-eyed to the wind and opens it. Benny stands outside, holding a shoe box.

dialogues.speaker: BENNY
dialogues.text: (WITH PURPOSE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had a dream. Get dressed. We're goin' to the sandlot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys march toward the rising sun - across the sandlot behind Benny. Toward destiny.

dialogues.speaker: THE GREEN FIBERGLASS FENCE
dialogues.text: They stop here. Benny steps forward. He opens the shoe bo Laces on brand new P.F. Flyers. Moves for the fence. Scot grabs his arm.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTTY
dialogues.text: Benny - wait. It's okay, it was my fault. I'll just take whatever I get.  bulking You don't have to do this. 97 A look in Benny's eyes. Kismet.

dialogues.speaker: BENNY
dialogues.text: (PREDESTINED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah I do, Smalls. I have to. Benny turns from him - swallows hard. Swings himself onto

dialogues.speaker: TOP OF THE FENCE
dialogues.text: and balances - deciding.

dialogues.speaker: THE BABE'S VOICE
dialogues.text: (in Benny's head) ...Follow your heart, kid, and you'll never go wrong. Benny turns back one last time. Gives Scotty "Thumbs Up." With a pearl diver's breath - he plunges into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...here. He stands fixed, staring hard 'neath the lean-to

dialogues.speaker: DUST RISES
dialogues.text: from thereunder. ORGANIC EXHAUST. The LAZY CLINKS of heav chain links... The Beast is rising to its feet.

dialogues.speaker: IT MATERIALIZES
dialogues.text: piece by piece: fore feet the size of a catcher's mitt, head and shoulders, hulking flank and haunches.

dialogues.speaker: BENNY 'S
dialogues.text: mouth hangs open. He's frozen, staring at

dialogues.text: and it's worse than Squints recounted... because it's rea  smelling ground. This is the biggest dog that ever lived! 300 lbs. 4 1/2 feet tall. And ugly. This was a bad idea. The Beast linge 8 feet away with slack in the chain. THWOOOP! It spits something out, which rolls in the dirt.

dialogues.speaker: BETWEEN THEM
dialogues.text: A goo-slobbered ball. Dirty Beast-foam drips off, reveali the smeared signature, BABE RUTH. "G'head kid, I dare you!" 98

dialogues.speaker: A PICKLE
dialogues.text: Benny measures The Beast. Times its ballooning chest. The Beast's eyes glue to Benny. Flopping, hot-water-bottl tongue PANTS. Licks chops. Leather'd nose twitches - for movement.

dialogues.speaker: THE TOE
dialogues.text: of Benny's P.F. Flyer digs into the cracked earth.

dialogues.speaker: CLINK
dialogues.text: the Beast leans forward - one chain link lifts from the

dialogues.speaker: SHTHUFT
dialogues.text: Benny spits, blowing his tanks.

dialogues.speaker: THE BEAST
dialogues.text: bristles.

dialogues.speaker: BENNY'S EYES
dialogues.text: widen, focusing.

dialogues.speaker: WAR BREAKS OUT
dialogues.text: Benny goes for the ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: knotted muscles quaver and UNCOIL.

dialogues.speaker: BENNY 'S
dialogues.text: P.F. Flyers leave behind tiny dust roosters.

dialogues.speaker: THE BEAST'S
dialogues.text: claws dig deep furrows. FOG BANKS of dust spread out behi it. Forelegs gallop at flared, over-anxious angles.

dialogues.speaker: BENNY
dialogues.text: leaves scrambling footprints. He slides - grabs the ball "Pops-Up" Maury Wills fashion - heads back for the fence. The ball slips from Benny's fingers. Re-grabs it - shoves the ball in his teeth, freeing his hands for the leap up fence. 99

dialogues.speaker: THE BEAST
dialogues.text: gains. SHNAPP! Jaws SHUT like a tripped bear trap.

dialogues.speaker: BENNY
dialogues.text: springs off the ground. He's on the fence.

dialogues.speaker: THE BEAST
dialogues.text: reaches chain's end - it goes taught. Breaks! The two foo length still attached to The Beast's neck bullwhips - the chain catches Benny in the butt.

dialogues.speaker: YOWWWWW
dialogues.text: He vaults over the fence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gang looks up. A great shadow envelopes them.  Jumpers.

dialogues.speaker: THE BEAST IS LOOSE
dialogues.text: The guys turn to stone. Benny takes off.

dialogues.speaker: OOOOH SSSSHIT
dialogues.text: The Beast tears by the guys after Benny. The two vanish o of the sandlot.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTTY
dialogues.text: What're we waitin' for?! Let's go after 'em!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benny runs. The Beast is gaining. In its wake: dichondra lawns RIPPED to shreds. Scotty and the guys make tracks a block behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On display: Pinwheels, Mailbox Propellers and Puddle- Benny flies by. The Beast follows. As they pass, contact: the whirly-gigs take off!

dialogues.text: (BEAMING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommy, mommy - wook! Ah, ah - goggy! (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big goggy. The Mother looks out the passenger window.

dialogues.text: Benny and The Beast run even. Then pull ahead.  garbage under

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benny's cookin'. The Beast follows - TRASHCANS SCATTER li bowling pins. Scotty and the guys follow. All slow to check out the bins... so many crushed beer cans. Benny darts in the rear entrance to a "random" building. Beast tears after him - KNOCKING the door off its hinges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE MOVIE SCREEN Kong does battle with T Rex.

dialogues.speaker: BENNY
dialogues.text: comes sliding AT US across the waxed stage floor - from the movie screen. He slides off the stage - into midair - lands on his feet. Splits up the aisle between the rows o folding chairs and blasts out the door.

dialogues.speaker: KIDS' HEADS
dialogues.text: turn to watch him. KONG ROARS! They look back at

dialogues.speaker: THE MOVIE SCREEN
dialogues.text: where, just as Kong proclaims himself king over the dead Rex,

dialogues.speaker: THE BEAST
dialogues.text: Leaps through the center of the silver screen - leaves a foot hole - lands 20 feet down the aisle - CRASHES throug the doors and disappears. Moments pass. Our guys follow. 101

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hot-rubber SQUEAKS from Benny's P.F. Flyers. The Beast's  control booth claws leave jagged scars in the concrete.

dialogues.speaker: CATS HISS
dialogues.text: in terror and faint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POOL HONEYS lounge, all bedecked with rock-hard, Annette Funicello hairdo's. Benny blasts out of the pool building, "tire stepping" ov the Honeys. They're up and RANTING at him. Until, The Bea comes... ...Sliding across the water-slippy deck like an out-of- anvil. He "bowling pins" the Pool Honeys. The Honeys HIT THE WATER. Benny cuts back through the pool building. The Beast foll parting our guys and the other Kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Game in progress. From outta nowhere, Benny jams across t diamond. The game stops... EVERYONE gapes at: Some huge dog-beast charging after a kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big banner: "FOUNDER'S DAY!" Perfectly arranged picnic blankets covered with wonderful spreads of goodies.

dialogues.speaker: BENNY
dialogues.text: zips under the banner - runs through - grabs a Coke like long distance runner.

dialogues.speaker: THE BEAST
dialogues.text: rages after him, through:

dialogues.speaker: A DEADEND
dialogues.text: of neatly arranged display booths. (This is pie n' cake gag per storyboards - allow 2 pages.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 102 Founder's Day parade (et al).

dialogues.speaker: BENNY
dialogues.text: rips into the square. He rubba-leg zigzags, nimbly avoidi everything and everyone.

dialogues.speaker: THE BEAST
dialogues.text: Is a runaway freight train. He PLOWS through CLOWNS.

dialogues.speaker: CHILDREN
dialogues.text: are snatched from the dog's path by terrified parents. Th Beast tears through the concession stands:

dialogues.speaker: VATS
dialogues.text: EXPLODE! The VOLUNTEERS dash out SCREAMING - "tar n' featherd" with baked beans and potato chips.

dialogues.speaker: BENNY
dialogues.text: zips through the MARCHING BAND - ducking trombone slides leaping glockenspiels.

dialogues.speaker: THE BEAST
dialogues.text: ain't so graceful. He "barn-doors" the band. CRASH! An instrument tangled heap.

dialogues.speaker: THE ONLOOKERS
dialogues.text: pour into the street, knocking the MAYOR from his convertible, and the FOUNDER'S DAY QUEEN from her float.

dialogues.speaker: FROM THIS HEIGHT
dialogues.text: this all looks like the end of a "Dr. Suess" book!

dialogues.speaker: SCOTTY AND THE GANG
dialogues.text: search through the confusion. _They've lost Benny_! Suddenly, doubling back on them

dialogues.speaker: BENNY
dialogues.text: Sandlot! Benny's gone. Seconds later - The Beast follows.

dialogues.speaker: SQUINTS
dialogues.text: This way! Shortcut! 103

dialogues.speaker: THE GANG
dialogues.text: forges through the disaster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gang's GASPING for BREATH. And then, unbelievably

dialogues.speaker: BENNY
dialogues.text: Are coming right at them! They race across the sandlot. Kill- anxious beast-drool splashes the seat of Benny's pants.

dialogues.speaker: THE BEAST'S
dialogues.text: muscles flex.

dialogues.speaker: BENNY
dialogues.text: just runs. He runs as if a big dog was chasing him. lurches a step - RIP! A pants pocket flaps from an inciso

dialogues.text: He lays down the world's all-time most perfect SLIDE. careens toward the bottom of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hits it and, defying gravity, RUNS STRAIGHT UP THE GREEN

dialogues.speaker: BENNY
dialogues.text: jets upward, leaving smashed green fiberglass footsteps - standing out from the fence 90 degrees - the Donald O'Con "Singin' In The Rain" trick!

dialogues.speaker: THE BEAST
dialogues.text: sucks air - ROARS - EXPLODES from the ground - soars, gap maw first, right for

dialogues.speaker: BENNY
dialogues.text: who pushes off the top of the fence.

dialogues.speaker: THE BEAST
dialogues.text: GNASHES up at Benny's heels - misses by an inch. He plumm toward the Badlands. Then, the unspeakable happens, 104

dialogues.speaker: THE BABE RUTH AUTOGRAPH
dialogues.text: and comes tumbling down after the ball.

dialogues.speaker: BENNY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh noooooo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benny HITS the dirt with a gut twisting THUD! Dust everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gang climbs the fence. They look down into  struggles

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: where, when the dust clears, they see

dialogues.speaker: BENNY
dialogues.text: holding the Babe Ruth Autograph up high like a trophy.

dialogues.speaker: BENNY
dialogues.text: I Got IT!

dialogues.speaker: THE GANG
dialogues.text: hops down and races over. Suddenly, from the

dialogues.speaker: FENCETOP
dialogues.text: His shirt snagged:

dialogues.speaker: SCOTTY
dialogues.text: Help him! I'm stuck! I'm stuck! Help him!

dialogues.speaker: THE BEAST
dialogues.text: is hanging from the fence. His chain has caught. He choking to death - right below Scotty.

dialogues.speaker: THE GANG
dialogues.text: petrifies where they stand. 105

dialogues.speaker: SCOTTY
dialogues.text: tears his shirt loose. Scrambles to where The Beast hangs Tries to lift the tow chain free - too heavy! He'll die i seconds.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTTY
dialogues.text: Pick him up! Scoot him up so I can let him off! (DESPERATE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: moves. They wanna but they can't!

dialogues.speaker: SCOTTY
dialogues.text: goes for broke. He reaches out and puts his hand on The Beast's head.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTTY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (CONTACT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy. Easy, boy.

dialogues.speaker: THE BEAST
dialogues.text: whimpers. Scotty balances atop the fence. Grabs the tow chain. Lifts with all his might... his fingers bleed. The Beast goes limp. An inch. That did it! The beast falls.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTTY
dialogues.text: goes with him - 8 feet to the dirt. The FENCE COMES DOWN breaking the barrier to the sandlot. He lands on the grou

dialogues.speaker: NOSE TO NOSE
dialogues.text: with The Beast.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTTY
dialogues.text: leaps to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: THE BEAST
dialogues.text: rises with him.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTTY
dialogues.text: freezes solid. 106

dialogues.speaker: THE GANG
dialogues.text: watches in horror.

dialogues.speaker: THE BEAST
dialogues.text: That's scans them instinctively - He might kill them all where t stand.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTTY'S
dialogues.text: about to load up his fruit o' da looms.

dialogues.speaker: THE BEAST
dialogues.text: sticks his mammoth head right in Scotty's face. SNIFFS. it! The kid is lunch! His jowls part - hot BEAST-BREATH BLOWS Scotty's hair back.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTTY
dialogues.text: closes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: THE GANG
dialogues.text: SLAP their hands to their eyesockets.

dialogues.speaker: THE BEAST
dialogues.text: leans closer. Mouth opens. Cold-leather nose presses agai Scotty's forehead. Then... He licks Scotty's face.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTTY
dialogues.text: wipes away the Beast slob. He doesn't even have to kneel down to read the name on The Beast's "doggy tag." It says ..-Hercules. This time Scotty gives Benny "Thumbs Up."

dialogues.speaker: UNDER THE LEAN-TO
dialogues.text: Hercules digs, then stands away.

dialogues.speaker: THE GANG
dialogues.text: steps closer. Look into the hole. Their faces light up wi wonder. In

dialogues.speaker: THE HOLE
dialogues.text: Are 150 baseballs.  107

dialogues.speaker: BENNY
dialogues.text: We can play forever now.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTTY
dialogues.text: takes The Beast by the collar. He and Benny go to

dialogues.speaker: MR. MERTLE'S BACK DOOR
dialogues.text: Scotty KNOCKS. MR. MERTLE answers the door. An old man wi dark glasses. He comes out on the porch.

dialogues.speaker: MR. MERTLE
dialogues.text: Hello?...

dialogues.speaker: SCOTTY
dialogues.text: Um, we brought your dog home.

dialogues.speaker: MR. MERTLE
dialogues.text: Hercules? How'd he get out?

dialogues.speaker: SCOTTY
dialogues.text: Well, sir... um, we kind of, well, what happened was —

dialogues.speaker: BENNY
dialogues.text: - we hit a baseball into your yard. Then we tried to get it and -

dialogues.speaker: MR. MERTLE
dialogues.text: - why didn't you just come to the door... I'd have gotten it for you. Squints, Yeah-Yeah, Ham, DeNunez, Repeat, Timmy and Bertr faint.

dialogues.speaker: MR. MERTLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well, thanks for bringin' him back. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you boys come in... we can talk about baseball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fairly spartan, except for one room, where it seems that Mertle spends most of his time. He leads Benny and Scott

dialogues.speaker: THE BASEBALL ROOM
dialogues.text: Mr. Mertle sits at a table. Benny and Scotty stare at the tabletop. 108 It holds a scale model Baseball Diamond: green felt field and little bases, outfield wall and miniature player figures. picture on the wall of Mr. Mertle and Babe Ruth.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTTY
dialogues.text: You knew Babe Ruth?

dialogues.speaker: MR. MERTLE
dialogues.text: Yeah. And he knew me too. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They never let us play together, but we were friends. Good friends. He was almost as great a hitter as I was. But, he'd of told you he was better. The picture is signed: "To Thelonius Johnson Mertle, the second greatest slugger I ever saw... Babe Ruth." A baseball game on the RADIO. As each play is CALLED, Mr. Mertle's hands deftly put his tiny players in the correct positions. Mr. Mertle is blind.

dialogues.speaker: MR. MERTLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (HOLDING BALL)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This the one that went over my fence?

dialogues.speaker: BENNY
dialogues.text: Yeah. Mr. Mertle brushes his fingers over the leather.

dialogues.speaker: MR. MERTLE
dialogues.text: This is an old ball, boys. Really old. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hercules gave it a good chewing, didn't  he?

dialogues.speaker: SCOTTY
dialogues.text: (WEAK)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: MR. MERTLE
dialogues.text: You sound upset, son - what's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: SCOTTY
dialogues.text: Well, you see... that ball belongs to my stepdad... and, uh - it was signed by Babe Ruth. Mr. Mertle shakes his head... hands the ball to Scotty. 109

dialogues.speaker: MR. MERTLE
dialogues.text: Hmm. Well, I'm sure your dad will understand.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTTY
dialogues.text: I don't think so. On the RADIO, Wills steals second.

dialogues.speaker: MR. MERTLE
dialogues.text: (TO BENNY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son, move Maury Wills to second base for me, will ya? Benny moves the little figure to second base.

dialogues.speaker: MR. MERTLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If he steals third that'll be number 100. (TO SCOTTY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helluva pickle you're in, boy.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTTY
dialogues.text: Yes, sir... Mr. Mertle retrieves something from a glass case. A baseball.

dialogues.speaker: MR. MERTLE
dialogues.text: I'll make you a deal. If you boys  come over once a week and talk baseball with me, I'll trade you balls.

dialogues.speaker: BENNY
dialogues.text: Well, that's really nice of you... but this ball really is signed by The Babe.

dialogues.speaker: MR. MERTLE
dialogues.text: (CHUCKLES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This one really is too... and all the rest of the '27 Yankees. He hands his baseball to Scotty... Benny stares at it in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: BENNY
dialogues.text: Oh my God - Murderers' Row. As they ogle the ball:

dialogues.speaker: BENNY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (AWED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lou Gehrig... 110

dialogues.speaker: SCOTTY
dialogues.text: Babe Ruth.

dialogues.speaker: MR. MERTLE
dialogues.text: (SMILING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're all there. Scotty hands Mr. Mertle the chewed up Babe Ruth ball. Sha his hand.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTTY
dialogues.text: Deal. On the RADIO, Maury Wills steals 3rd for his 100th stolen base. Scotty notices the wall clock:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom's car is in the driveway. Scotty goes up the walkway slowly. Benny just behind him. The gang lingers at the  sidewalk. Scotty sets one foot on the

dialogues.speaker: PORCH
dialogues.text: and Bill comes out. He looks none-too-pleased. He towers over Scotty. The gang hangs their heads.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: This better be good. Benny unpockets a little felt bag. Hands it to Scotty. He holds the bag up to a perplexed Bill, who opens it. He lo from Scotty to Benny and back again. Then... ...Stares down at the "Murderers' Row" ball. CcuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BASEBALL sailing through the air. SMACK! it's caught in brand new glove. Scotty's new glove. Scotty snap throws t ball back to Bill. He and Scotty are having a great game catch.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: It was weird that Benny said Babe Ruth was like the Hercules of baseball, and then The Beast's name turned out to be Hercules. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was also strange that Mr. Mertle had a Murderers' Row ball to replace the one signed by The Babe. 111 Bill and Scotty smile as they fire the cowhide back and forth.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Some people might say that it was all a coincidence... but looking back at it now, it seems like everything was connected, just like me and Benny. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was like we were a part of the same myth as The Babe... the Myth of  Baseball. Scotty's mom sticks her head out the back door. She smile watching her "two boys" toss the ball around.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Guys, supper's ready.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: (FORMERLY BILL)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give us another ten minutes. I'm helpin' my boy break in his new glove.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Mertle sits contentedly behind his little "diamond." RADIO ANNOUNCER calls Maury Wills' 104th steal of 1962.

dialogues.speaker: MR. MERTLE'S DIAMOND
dialogues.text: HIS HAND moves a wooden figure from lst to 2nd. This tact "playing field" becomes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...this one, where the guys are playing ball. There's a n addition to their team. A mascot. A big mascot.

dialogues.speaker: HERCULES
dialogues.text: in a t-shirt and cap.

dialogues.speaker: THE GUYS
dialogues.text: all play as if, somehow, this may be the last time they e get to be a team. As they play, they're "sponged" from th PICTURE in this order: Yeah-Yeah, Repeat and Timmy, Ham, DeNunez, Bertram, Squints, Hercules, Scotty, Benny.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: That was the last summer that we all got to play together. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But it would stay with us forever. (as they all dissolve:) Yeah-Yeah's parents shipped him off to military school. Timmy and Tommy grew up to build skyscrapers. Ham went to college and became a pediatrician. DeNunez played triple A ball and never got to the majors. Bertram got really into the sixities and no one ever saw him again. Squints grew up and married Wendy Peffercorn; they bought the Five & Dime and they still own it to this day. Hercules lived to be 199 years old... in human years. Everyone but Benny has vanished from the Sandlot.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: After Benny pickled the Beast, his reputation spread all over town. From then on he was known as Benny "The Juet" Rodriguez.

dialogues.speaker: BENNY'S P.F. FLYER
dialogues.text: comes down on home plate and vanishes, leaving

dialogues.speaker: THE SANDLOT
dialogues.text: empty.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The nickname stuck with him the rest of his life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dodger stadium. A ROAR goes up inside the ballpark.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: (FAMILIAR)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a triple, and that'll put the winning run on third, with two out in the bottom of the ninth. What a shot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the dugout, TOMMY LASORDA calls for a pinch runner. PLAYER comes out of the dugout, stripping off his warm-up jacket.  takes 113

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Lasorda's sending in a pinch runner - and it'll be... (DRAMATIC PAUSE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe it! Lasorda's calling up the "Old Man" to pinch-run in the biggest clutch situation this season! They say the veteran's lost a step or two. But if I were you, I'd get ready for some fireworks.

dialogues.speaker: THE CROWD
dialogues.text: is on its feet as 40-year-old BENNY "THE JET" RODRIGUEZ over third base from the PLAYER already there. They shake hands on the exchange. The 3rd base COACH walks over to T Jet. Pats him on the back.

dialogues.speaker: COACH
dialogues.text: (GRINNING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give 'em hell, Jet.

dialogues.speaker: THE JET
dialogues.text: I'll do my best, Maury. The Coach moves into the coaching box... turning his back us. Emblazoned across his jersey, is the name WILLS.

dialogues.speaker: THE PITCHER
dialogues.text: takes the signal.

dialogues.speaker: THE JET
dialogues.text: leads off 3rd base - ten steps! The Pitcher fires to 3rd. The Jet hand tags.

dialogues.speaker: THE PITCHER
dialogues.text: settles.

dialogues.speaker: THE JET
dialogues.text: leads off. Eleven steps.

dialogues.speaker: THE PITCHER
dialogues.text: fires to 3rd again. The Jet gets back.

dialogues.speaker: THE JET
dialogues.text: leads off again. Twelve steps. The pitch - strike. The CATCHER tosses it back. Just then... 114 ...The Jet moves. So fast that no one knows he's gone til it's too damn late. The Pitcher awkwardly throws home. Th Catcher wipes the baseline. Too late... ...the dust clears. The UMPIRE eagle-wings the air.

dialogues.speaker: SAFE
dialogues.text: The tag missed by two feet. It's all over. The Crowd jump to its feet. The Dodger dugout is all over The Jet.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: The Dodgers win the pennant! The Dodgers win the pennant! The Jet breaks through his adoring teammates just long enough to give "Thumbs Up" to...

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I don't believe it, the Old Man stole home! The Old Man -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...39-year-old SCOTT SMALLS - The Announcer - who returns "Thumbs Up." scott (after a pause) The Jet stole home! The Jet stole home! !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Jet signs autographs for swarming KIDS. As the CROWD'  CHEERING CONTINUES and ECHOES into the past, we CcuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: A FADED KODACHROME PHOTO
dialogues.text: of the 9 best (11-year-old) buddies that ever lived. On a makeshit baseball diamond - a sandlot... circa 1962. They all holding something forward - displaying - one palm up, hand beneath another - together like the nine musketeers: A baseball. A baseball with a familiar smudge. END TITLES. FADE OUT.
